result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie Charles McDaniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Charles McDaniels

records.addlTxt: JOC w/counts 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6.

Defendant Willie Charles McDaniels in court.  
Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Willie Charles McDaniels.  
Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Probation Review Hearing. 
Court advised the Probation agent need additional time to prepare a report.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Willie Charles McDaniels in court.  
Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Willie Charles McDaniels.  
Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Restitution Hearing.  Discussion held.
Court ordered restitution in the amount of $7500.00 to Home Depot Corporation. 
Payable  by the end of  probation or  civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Court Ordered defendant to serve 9 Months in the House of Correction with credit for 211 Days. 
Huber to apply for work, treatment and childcare. 

COUNT 2 :  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 42 Months, concurrent to Counts 3, 4, 5 ,6, with credit for Zero days time served; 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is18 Months; MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   24 Months. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 3 Years.  
Defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program

COUNT 3 :  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 42 Months, concurrent to Counts 2, 4, 5 ,6, with credit for Zero days time served; 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is18 Months; MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   24 Months.COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 3 Years.  

COUNT 4 :  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 42 Months, concurrent to Counts 2, 3, 5 ,6, with credit for Zero days time served; 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is18 Months; MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   24 Months. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 3 Years.  

COUNT 5 :  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 42 Months, concurrent to Counts 2, 3, 4 ,6, with credit for Zero days time served; 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is18 Months; MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   24 Months. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 3 Years.  

COUNT 6 :  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 42 Months, 
Concurrent to Counts 2, 3, 4 ,5, with credit for Zero days time served; 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is18 Months; MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   24 Months. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 3 Years.  


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION / EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
120 Days of Condition Time  on Count 2  imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing. on 10-27-2022 at 11:00am.  
Pay DNA surcharge within 36 Months  or Civil Judgment.
Pay Supervision fees as determined by the agent.  
Court waived all other mandatory and non mandatory costs due to inability to pay.. 
Restitution set at Zero pending restitution hearing. 
AODA assessment 
Attend Treatment and counseling programs determined by agent.
Cooperate with probation agent. 
Obtain/Maintain Employment or attend school.
Random Urine Screens.
No Contact with any Home Depot
No association with any known drug dealers  manufactures or houses. 
Court advised the defendant as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised the defendant he may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored 
Appellate rights

Probation Review Hearing scheduled October 27, 2022 at 11:00am.
Restitution hearing scheduled October 27, 2022 at 11:00am

Defendant Willie Charles McDaniels in court, in custody.  
Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Willie Charles McDaniels. 
Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea and Sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 1 - COUNT 6:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. 
 Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and  he may not vote in any election until his her civil rights are restored. 
Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample nd advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNT 7 - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Case proceeds to sentencing.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Willie Charles McDaniels not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant has a new case in Waukesha County. Defense requested an adjournment. State did not object. Court granted the request. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
